message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SD 

This paper deals with the problem of estimating the location of tweets, which involves natural language processing, machine learning, and data mining techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which focuses on the analysis of social media data. The paper also uses language models to extract location signals from tweets, which suggests that it could be classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper proposes novel metrics of accuracy, precision, and calibration, which are relevant to the field of information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also deals with the problem of missing geographic information, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cyber-physical systems (cs.CY). Finally, the paper uses a variant of gaussian mixture models, which could be relevant to the sub-category of statistical learning (cs.SD).
